item.title: The Book of Five Rings
item.description: In many areas of life, but particularly martial arts, an overemphasis is placed on technique, showmanship and equipment. The martial arts that Musashi1 teach are simple, direct and practical.

item.title: Happy
item.description: I read this before I started doing chapter summaries, but I got a lot from this book and it is well worth the time.

item.title: The Art of Learning
item.description: Summary The book is partly an overview of Waitzkin’s successful careers as a high-level chess player and martial artist, partly a philosophical treatise on the nature of learning.

item.title: The Emancipated Spectator
item.description: The book is a ‘critique of’ critique of the spectacle, described as the belief that the bombardment of images and spectacles has rendered democractic subjects passive and ignorant.

item.title: Walden
item.description: Unfortunately I’ve lost my notes for the last two chapters of Walden. I’m putting this incomplete summary up for now, hopefully I’ll be able to dig out the rest.
